messages.body:
14 September 2006
Good Day 
Greetings! 
I would like to apply through this medium for your co-operation and to secure an opportunity to invest and do joint business with you in your country ,i feel confident therefore to introduce myself and this offer to you based on this problem of war in my country. I have a substantial capital i honourably intend to invest in your country into a very lucrative business venture of which you are to advise and execute the said venture over there for the mutual benefits of both of us. 
I will make my proposal well known if I am given the opportunity I would like to use this opportunity to introduce myself to you. Well my name is Petterson Zema the only surviving son of MR fredrick Zema a diamond dealer from KENEMA in Sierra Leone .My father is now late he died some months back during the last and current crisis in my country Sierra Leone .He was Killed by the rebels for refusing to join and sponsor them. 
The main reason why I am contacting you now is to seek your assistance in the area of my future investment and also for a help hand over some huge amount of money he left behind. This money 4.8million dollars is deposited in a security and trust company in Dakar Senegal for safe keeping some years ago by my father and he made me the sole beneficiary .I am now asking you to stand on my behalf to claim the deposit from the security company and assist me on investing it as well in your country.  
I have made up my mind to offer you 25% of the total sum and also map out 5% for any expenses that will be made during the transaction while the remaining will go into investment and my use.
As I have mention earlier I will make the procedure to this issue to be well known to you if I am given the opportunity to do so in my next message .Pls attach your direct and full information as you reply to this mail also include your personal contact phone number for more easy communication.
Thanks and remain bless
Petterson Zema

messages.body:
Mr Zena,
I'm willing to help you as much as I can, though I can't promise that you can get into Australia - DIMIA writes its own rules. 
I can promise you too that I'm not going to run away with your money - $1.2 million is still a lot of cash. But, before we go any further, let's look at some issues.
One is, you want me to stand for you in recovering your dad's cash. How does this work? From what I can see, in every possible way I am not you. How does this work?
Just so you know - I'm a photomodel, 23 as of last month, living happily in Sydney with four other models; my boyfriend AJ (not live-in) is my photographer.  Here's a pic, my favourite from a shoot in Queensland in July.
Back to you.
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
18 September 2006
Hello Eliza,
I am happy to receive and read you mail and i must say here that your words has given me some confidence to work with you as my foriegn partner in this project. Thank you for your beautiful photo, you look pretty nice in there,i hope to send you my photo as soon as i get a place to scan it. My coming to Australia will not be any problem because i have made arrangment on that through one ambasador for mutiple visa the only thing it will cost me some money but that won't be any problem when we retrieve the cash from the security and trust company, down here in Senegal. traveling abroad is easy once you have your cash so don't bother yourself about my visa, i will get it at the appropriate time.
Coming to your questions,how the business will work is this: 
Because of my status here as a refugee  the laws of Senegal does not permit me to handle any sort of business transaction , for this reason i will introduce you to the trust company as my foreign partner and family friend whom i have mandated to receive the safe deposit. I have discussed this issue with the manager of the trust company so all they need is for  you to file an application for claim  to their office for the process of the deposit, after the application is submitted they will now issue you a CHANGE OF BENEFICIARY FORM which you will fill as my appointed agent and new beneficiary to enable them officially process and release the deposit to you as my foreign. So all that is needed is for me to forward an authorization letter to the trust company introducing you as my foreign partner, after this an application letter will be submitted , after the application letter the trust company will issue you a change of beneficiary form to change the beneficiary from my name to your name. After the trust company effect the necessary changes to your name, they will process the deposit for shipment to your place through a security diplomatic courier system, you will get to know more about when the time for it come, we will not transfer the money from here to Australia because of some many logistics with local banks here because african banking system is very poor also alot of eyes will be on the money if we should take it to the bank which is not good for us because terrorist problems around the world so the best way to move the cash out of this place to Australia is through security diplomatic system which is very safe and secure way of transporting confidential valuables from one country to another, don't worry you will know more about this when we get to it.
I want you to call me on this number as soon as you receive this mail for confirmation, you can get me on this number:+221-578.84.48. I also would like to have your mobile number so we can communicate each other because communication is very important in this business  Please remember to conceal this matter to yourself because you can not tell the mind of the next person to you, this is to proctect our life from bad people because someone may here that we have such money and plan evil against us or even try to kill to take the money so please it will be very safe for is to keet every thing we do secret. Down here in senegal i didn't tell an ybody about it and nobody will ever know until we finish the business and travel out of here. I wait your phone call and  reply. please note that the country code for Senegal is 221, their is no city or area code, all need  do is just dial the country code follow by the 7 digit numbers to get me on phone.
Regards
Zena

messages.body:
Mr Zena - or Petterson -
I wouldn't be too sure about coming to Oz, DIMIA can be assholes, and if you'd ever read about the Alvarez case, TOTAL assholes...
OK - I'm your "foreign partner and family friend" - Holy Odin, I can see a few nudge nudge, wink wink comments there - will anyone believe it? As long as you know what you're doing...
Final note - you said that I have to keep this private, yes? Well, that's why I can't call you. It's a sure bet that someone would overhear - we live pretty much in each other's pockets in this house. No way to get around that, believe you me!
Keep me posted.
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
Mr Zena,
Aagh... easy to forget that big stories here don't rate well (if at all) anywhere else... 
OK then. Vivian Alvarez is a Filipina who took out Australian citizenship. About five years ago, after a split with her husband, she was found in Queensland, in distress, and locked up as a possible illegal immigrant. 
Not long after that she was deported to the Philippines - mainly, IIRC, because one of the DIMIA guys concerned convinced himself that she was a sex-slave who wanted to go home. When I said "Total assholes" I was thinking of that shithead!
On the other matter - I have a mobile but it's rigged to a local-only setting; public phone boxes are few and far between; and what do you mean by "phone shops"?
Too, I can't predict when would be the right time to receive a call, or when I could make one. 
So, you'd better send me this Kouassi dude's email address if you want me to get in touch...
Eliza Dane

24 September 2006
Dear Eliza,
How are you today hope fine,  i thank you for your mail . Coming to your questions , the main purpose that i am in Senegal is to arrange for the transfer of my inheritance out of this country because Senegal election is coming close and you don't really know what will happen next. Politics here is a game of death not as you have it there, elections usually bring problems and fightings but i beleive one day africa politics will improve to western standard for the leaders to understand why they are there, they are to serve the people and not to loot the economy and make people go hungry and homeless, well is a bitter tging discussing political situation down here. I have to tell you everthing because i see you as a sister.I want you to also see me as a brother to you then we will achieve our goal quickly.
At my free tome i listen to music, read some novels if i have some around me, go to beach and visit parks to see animals. I haven't had any pleasure since i came to senegal because i came here suddenly, i am just adjusting to the situation here until we finish the process, secure the money in your custody then i will start my normal life again, when you are face with so many problems at young age pleasures will fly away from you. 
I am 25 years, i have attach a photo for you to see my, this photo was taken when things where going on well in Free town before the rebel crisis so i hope you will like the photo, i have a mother and two sistersbut my mother is in another region where they were kept under united nations refugee, i got a message from them yesterday that she is sick so am praying for her to get well soon, i need to take propare care of her abroad because she has suffered to horrible setback after the death of my father and some other family poblems which is a long story.



We lost every property in my country but lets don't talk about it because i feel sad and cry each time i remember the ugly event that took place there. lets work like sister and brother then we will meet soon to smile together as family friend. Now is your turn to tell me more about your parents, family.
Please keep constant communication  with the attorney so he will issue you the document on time because i want this deposit money to move out of this place as quickly as possible.
Thank you my sister and have a good evening.
Zema

messages.body:
Petterson,
Reading your story makes me realise (again) how lucky I am. My life has been very peaceful and placid and this whole country is a very peaceful place (even in footy season). My parents are still alive and living in the country, as they always wanted, in "genteel rural retirement". I have a brother and a sister, both older - my brother Ross is serving in Afghanistan with the SASR, and my sister Sophie runs a pharmacy. As you can see, all is very pleasant, and I am so lucky to be alive when and where I am, and lucky to be blessed with beauty. Freya looked kindly on me the day I was born.
My boyfriend AJ is also my photographer. I'm lucky there too, because he's good at that as well as good-looking, and we have great sex!
I hope that you can share some of my luck now. Seems like you earned it!
Nothing from Mr Kouassi yet; I'll be in touch.
Eliza

Attn :Eliza Dane
Dear Client,
For an attorney or law firm to render any legal service to a client, the client is obliged to pay the legal charges of the attorney. This is the ethics of law profession except in special circumstance where the client has a retainership with such attorney. In your case i was contacted to  prepare / legalise a document which require court notarization and such service can ot be done without the client paying for the service. I am sure law practice is every country is almost the same, if i'm your personal or family attorney then is a different point.
Lawyer do not finance services of client here in Senegal,the money you were asked to pay will enable me prepare the document and have it stamp and legalise in court.
Upon receipt of your payment i will prepare the document, have it legalised in court, pay necessary
stamp duty. This will take me two business days and the document will thereafter be send to you via email attachment.
I remain at your service Thank you and best Regards
Nicolas KOUASSI Esq

Dear Eliza,
I can see you are angry from your mail, please calm yourself because everything we do in life go with understanding. 
In my opinion i think is not wise for the lawyer to include it in his invoice may be is was just being open to us not to hide anything. 
the only thing i see here is that people give bribes in some cases to receive quick service or attention which might be strange to you because is not so in your country. down here in african people take bribe to render service or they delay your job simply because you don't give bribes. major reasons for this is because government delay their salaries,sometime they don't pay them for three or two or even 4 months so all this give way for bribe in different government sector. imagine they use to owe teachers 4 or 5 months salary here and so many things like that so please don't blame the lawyer because is the bad system og government here that is why africa is a developing country, you can't compare here with your place where everything is easy. this is a place you see government owing the police salary for some months which is not normal so please over look all this and lets focus to whats ahead. i am tired of the way things are done here thats why i want to leave here as quickly as possible, power goes off here 4 times a day just imagine,please over look all this for us to progress becuse today is tuesday.let us make some progress this week. 
my suggestion is for to comply with the lawyer instruction because is the suffering we are facing here, he is a good person to tell you that because i know many lawyers won't say it ,they will hide it and it doesn't take him nothing to hide it and come up with anothr excuses so understand all this points.
I wait your news.
Just be happy and we will make it and forget about africa and its problems.
Regards
Petterson
